item.title: A basic openvpn bash wrapper with completion

item.title: Capitalizing on the Linux commands history
item.description: Working with Linux I tend to forget commands that Iâ€™m not using regularly. I also don’t like to retype a long command. Fortunately, the bash history can be used to find back those previous commands. The basic usage is to cycle through the bash history with the up and down keys, we also can use Ctrl-R to type the beginning of a command and autocomplete it according to the history.
